results.title: It's high time to lower cholesterol
results.creator_credit: Media Cast and National Heart Foundation of Australia
results.brief_description: Documentary arising out of the 7th International Symposium on Atherosclerosis, held in Melbourne 1985. This documentary examines atherosclerosis and focuses on how it develops, how it may be acquired, and steps that can be taken to reduce the risks of heart disease. The issue of lowering cholesterol by controlling the diet, eating a balanced diet with less fatty and high cholesterol foods and more vegetables and high fibre foods is stressed. Interviews with delegates to the symposium, cardiologists and dietitians are conducted.

results.title: Die Fledermaus
results.creator_credit: Leopold Lindtberg, Richard Gregson, Humphrey Burton, Arts Intl, BBC-TV and Royal Opera House Covent Garden
results.brief_description: The Royal Opera Chorus and the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, conducted by Placido Domingo, appear in this traditional Viennese comedy - the best known and most loved operetta by the King of the waltz, Johann Strauss the younger. Sung in German, with libretto in German and English, but no subtitles. This version has Kiri Te Kanawa as Rosalinde, Hermann Prey as Eisenstein, Hildegard Heichele as Adele and Benjamin Luxon as Falke. Music is directed by Sir Colin Davis.

results.title: I want to die at home
results.creator_credit: Monique Oomen, Vincent Burke, New Zealand Film Commission. Short Film Fund and TopShelf Productions
results.brief_description: In May 1988, Elizabeth died after a long battle with cancer of the liver. She chose to die at home, and this sensitive film documents her decision and the resources and support needed to carry out her wishes with dignity. Not only did Elizabeth decide against dying in a hospital but, in consultation with friends and family, she decided what should happen to her after death. This is not just Elizabeth’s story. It is the story of the friends and family who cared for her in dying and grieved for her in death. It is also a story - or rather the stories - of those left behind. A moving account of the elements necessary to make the choice to die at home.

results.title: It took a thief to stop a thief
results.creator_credit: Randy Grinter, Walter Shaw, Is Your Home Safe Inc and Media Productions
results.brief_description: This video covers everything from criminal attitude to locks, alarm systems, lighting, windows and position of the house. The video explores ways in which your house can be made more secure. Hosted by Walter Shaw with Eddie Egan.

results.title: The Little convict
results.creator_credit: Sandra Gross, Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In old New South Wales a new batch of convicts arrives including the little convict, young Toby Nelson. Consigned to a Government farm they are subjected to the cruelty of their tyrannical overseers, Sergeant Billy Langden and Corporal Weazel Wesley, finally resulting in the death of the pickpocket, Old Dipper. Toby escapes and flees into the alien Australian bush where he is saved from death by the aboriginal boy Wahroonga. Together with another escapee, highwayman Jack Doolan, and Wahroonga’s animal friends, they launch a spectacular mission to rescue the blacksmith Big George and Toby’s sister Polly. With Rolf Harris as a storyteller and the magic of live action and animation, this wonderful Australian historical adventure comes joyously to life.

results.title: A Long night with lethal guests
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Deals with malaria in New Guinea and research to find a cure. The film travels with a medical anthropologist to the rain-forest clad Schrader mountains where the Hagahai people live. The Hagahai people are being treated for malaria and other related infections transmitted through contact with the malaria-rife coast due to new road and air links. Researchers are looking at the way immunity to malaria works while treating people like the Hagahai.

results.title: Lord of the bush
results.brief_description: Lord Alistair McAlpine, entrepreneur and Treasurer of Margaret Thatcher’s Conservative Party is opening Broome for Tourism. Examines the issues that have been raised including Aboriginal land rights and the conflict between tourist developments and conservation. Interviews colourful Broome identities and their reactions to the changes.

results.title: Strictly ballroom
results.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Jill Bilcock, Tristram Miall, M and A Productions and Catherine Martin
results.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the “establishment” by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps and taking on a new ugly-duckling partner who blooms under his tutelage. Ballet dancer Paul Mercurio shot to fame with this film. He is partnered by Tara Morice and supported by Barry Otto, Gia Carides and Bill Hunter.

results.title: One eyed Jacks
results.creator_credit: Marlon Brando, Frank Rosenberg and Pennebaker Hegedus Films
results.brief_description: Charles Neider’s novel “The authentic death of Hendry Jones” is the source of this tellingly direct screenplay. It is the brooding, deliberate tale of a young man (Marlon Brando) consumed by a passion for revenge after he is betrayed by an accomplice (Karl Malden) in a bank robbery, for which crime he spends five years (1880-85) in a Mexican prison. His vengeful campaign leads him to the town of Monterey, where Malden has attained respectability and the position of sheriff, but romantic entanglements with Malden’s stepdaughter (Pina Pellicer) persuade Brando to abandon his intention until the irresistibility of circumstance and Malden’s own irrepressible will to snuff out the living evidence of his guilt draws the two men into a showdown. This film is a violent story of double-cross, suspicion and betrayal, and ranks as one of the all-time great Westerns. Watch for a special appearance by one of the movies great “cowboy” actors - Ben Johnson.

results.title: The Nutcracker prince
results.creator_credit: Paul Schibli, Kevin Gillis and Lacewood Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring the voices of Megan Follows, Keifer Sutherland, Phyllis Diller and Peter O’Toole, and set to Tchaikovsky’s score, this is a story of magic, adventure and romance. When Clara finds a nutcracker in the form of a soldier boy under the Christmas tree, her uncle tells her the story of the Nutcracker Prince turned to wood by the evil Mousequeen. The young Prince can only reverse the spell by fighting the terrible Mouseking and winning the love of a beautiful maiden.
